page.title: 06Ecology in Stallingborough
page.content: Natural History: The area has a fair cross section of different species of flora and fauna consistent with the type of habitat - mostly arable farmland. Conservation: The Parish Council is trying to negotiate with the Borough Council to save two of the fields of special interest from being developed for building. Climate and Weather: No extremes of climate or weather, but being a flat coastal area tends to be windy. Footpaths: There are app. 5 miles of footpaths, all clearly signposted and most are kept clear. Pollution: Several types of pollution - noise from heavy lorries. Air pollution from nearby factories, oil refinery and stubble burning at harvest time. Water pollution, the River Humber is polluted by factories along its banks and from its tributaries.
